course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: A decision has been discussed but not written down. What is the risk?
options: Implicit decisions cause misalignment; write what we chose and why
None; everyone was in the room
It will be forgotten
Writing takes too long

questions.question: In this framework, how is "choose with intent" defined or applied?
options: Use criteria and boundaries to decide; make the decision explicit
Let the loudest person decide for the team
Vote on everything and follow the majority
Delegate all decisions to someone else

questions.question: How do you avoid drift on decisions?
options: Make the decision explicit: what we chose, why, and what we are not doing
Meet more often
Assign a single decider
Avoid hard choices

questions.question: Delaying decision by asking for more data indefinitely leads to:
options: Drift; the default option or inaction wins without intent
Better decisions
More alignment
Lower risk

questions.question: Confusing consensus with a clear decision can result in:
options: No one owns the outcome; "everyone agreed" but no one wrote what was chosen
Faster execution
Higher satisfaction
No significant downside in practice

questions.question: What should you write down when you make a decision?
options: What we chose, why, and what we are not doing
Only the outcome and not the rationale
Only the date and not the rationale
Only who was present at the meeting

questions.question: A team keeps revisiting the same choice. What is likely missing?
options: An explicit decision with criteria and boundaries
More data
A different leader
A longer meeting
